phaseGroups.description: * Front-line health workers

* Persons ages ≥75 years
* Front-line critical workers
* Working or living in congregate settings 
* First responders including firefighters and law enforcement

Currently vaccinating:

* Adults 65-74 years
* Additional critical workers

Not yet vaccinating: Persons ages 16-64 years with high-risk medical conditions
* General public

* Front-line health workers
* Long-term care staff and residents

* Frontline EMS and fire service personnel providing medical services
* Community health aids
* Health care workers providing vaccinations
* Workers in health care settings who meet other certain criteria
* Persons aged 65 or older

* Persons aged 50-64 with a high-risk medical condition
* Frontline essential workers aged 50-64
* Pandemic response staff
* Educators
* People living or working in congregate settings

* Persons aged 55-64
* Persons aged 16 and above who: are essential workers, have certain medical conditions, live in a multigenerational household, or live in “unserved communities”

Still to be determined: 

* General public and under 16

* Health care workers
* Emergency medical workers
* Long-term care facility staff and residents

* Education and child care workers
* Adults 65 and older
* Protective services occupations (law enforcement, corrections, etc.)

Eligibility varies throughout Arizona. Some counties are vaccinating Phase 1B groups: 

* Certain essential workers
* Adults with high-risk medical conditions in congretate settings (such as shelters) 

Some counties are vaccinating Phase 1C groups:

* All adults with high-risk medical conditions
* All adults living in congregate settings

The state recently announced plans to move to an age-based eligibility system. Some counties are now vaccinating:

* Adults 55-64
* Adults 45-54
* Adults 35-44
* Adults 16-34

* Health care workers
* Long-term care residents and staff
* First responders

* People ages 65 and older
* Teacher and child care workers
* Manufacturing workers
* Essential government and community workers

* Adults with high-risk medical conditions
* Additional critical infrastructure workers

Still to be determined: 

* General public and under 16

* Health care workers
* Long-term care residents

Now vaccinating as supplies allow (varies locally):

* Adults 65+
* Education and child care 
* Emergency services
* Food and agriculture
* California residents ages 16 to 64 with certain health conditions and disabilities

Still to be determined: 

* General public and under 16

regions.notes: Note, the state website has removed references to phase 1b tier 2 and phase 1C. An example of the changes are https://www.placer.ca.gov/DocumentCenter/View/49578/COVID-Vaccine-Infographic-11421.

phaseGroups.description:
* Highest-risk health care workers (direct, prolonged COVID exposure)

* Long-term care staff and residents

* K-12 school personnel, law enforcement officers, and firefighters age 50 and above
* (NEW) CVS, Walmart, and Walgreens are vaccinating teachers of all ages 

Eligible later this month: Persons age 60-64

Still to be determined:

Still to be determined: 

* General public and under 16

* Health care providers
* Long-term care residents

Counties will work through the 1B tiers in the following order:

Tier 1

* Individuals 65+
* First responders
* PK-12 staff, early childhood education, child care workers

Tier 2

* Front-line essential workers (food, agriculture, distribution, and manufacturing sectors)
* Disabled individuals and care staff living in home settings

Tier 3

* Staff and individuals living in congregate settings
* Government officials/staff at state capitol

Tier 4

* Health, life, and safety inspectors

Tier 5

* Correctional facility staff and incarcerated individuals

Still to be determined: 

* General public and under 16

* Health care workers 
* Long-term care facilities
* Workers critical to pandemic response continuity

* Persons ages 65+ 
* Congregate settings 
* High-contact critical workers

* Persons ages 16-64 with severe medical risks 
* Other critical workers
* Persons ages 16-64 with other medical risks
* General public

* Long-term care and assisted living facilities
* Health care personnel

* First responders
* Anyone age 70 or older 
* K-12 school personnel

* Anyone age 60 or older 
* Anyone age 16 or older with certain high-risk conditions 
* All other essential workers
* Anyone age 40 or older
* General public
* Children under the age of 16 if the vaccine is approved for this age group

* Health care workers

* First responders serving as vaccinators

regions.notes: WARNING: The Minnesota website has a very nice graphic, but it is completely outdated. They've changed who is in what phase and removed any information about what the next phases look like.
